article v  numbering buildings footnotes  2  cross reference buildings and building regulations ch 18 uniform system established there is hereby established a uniform system of numbering houses and buildings fronting on all streets avenues and public ways in the village and all houses and buildings shall be numbered in accordance with the provisions of this article  baselines a north and south 1 frontage of all lots and undivided property facing on streets running north and south shall be numbered from a baseline which is haven avenue running east and west village beginning with number  on the north line of haven avenue and increasing numerically toward the north and beginning with number  on the south line of haven avenue and increasing numerically toward the south 2 the even numbers on streets running north and south shall be on the east side of the street and the odd numbers shall be on the west side of the street 3 that portion of streets running north and south lying north of the baseline shall bear the prefix north and that portion of such streets lying south of the baseline shall bear the prefix south b east and west 1 frontage of all lots and undivided property facing on streets running east and west shall be numbered from a baseline which is cedar road extending north and south village beginning with number  on the east line of cedar road and increasing numerically toward the east and beginning with number  on the west line of cedar road and increasing numerically toward the west 2 the even numbers on streets running east and west shall be on the south side of the street and the odd numbers shall be on the north side of the street 3 that portion of streets running east and west lying west of the baseline shall bear the prefix west and that portion of such streets lying east of the baseline shall bear the prefix east  assignment of numbers a there shall be assigned to each and every block north or south or east or west of the baseline established by this article 100 numbers the numbers within the first block shall be from 100 to 199 and the numbers in each succeeding block shall increase from the baseline in units of 100 namely the first block shall be 100 to 199 the second block shall be 200 to 299 the third block shall be 300 to 399 etc one number shall be assigned to each 25 feet of frontage b where blocks of different lengths occur on opposite sides of a street the numbers on both sides shall be assigned on the basis of the shorter block unless the village board shall otherwise determine c where any building has more than one door serving separate occupants a separate number shall be assigned to each door serving a separate occupant provided the building is 25 feet or more in width if the building is not 25 feet or more in width and the entrances are not that far apart the next consecutive number shall be marked fractional d buildings fronting on two or more streets shall have a number assigned only to the main entrance unless other entrances serve different occupants  numbering on streets not extending to baseline all streets not extending the baseline established by this article shall be assigned the same relative numbers as if the street had extended the baseline  placement of numbers required  size and location of numbers a the village board shall cause the necessary survey to be made and there shall be assigned to each house and building located on any street avenue or parkway in the village its respective number under the uniform system provided for in this article when the survey has been completed and each house and building has been assigned its respective number the owner occupant or agent shall place or cause to be placed on each house or building controlled by him the number assigned under the uniform system provided for in this article b such numbers shall be placed within 20 days after the assigning of the proper number c each of the figures of each such number assigned to any residence or building shall be not less than 212 inches high and except as to the figure  not less than 112 inches wide and such numbers shall be furnished by the property owner d the number shall be conspicuously placed immediately above on or at the side of the proper door of each building so that it can be plainly seen from the street whenever any building is situated more than 50 feet from the street line the number of each building shall be conspicuously displayed at the street line near the walk driveway or common entrance to such building so as to be easily discernible from the street  addition of suffix to number where only one number can be assigned to any house or building and the owner occupant or agent of such house or building desires a distinctive number for the upper and lower portion of any such house or building or for any part of such house or building fronting on any street such owner occupant or agent shall use the suffix a b etc as may be required  map for the purpose of facilitating correct numbering a plat book or map of all streets avenues and public highways within the village showing the proper numbers of all lots or houses fronting upon all such streets avenues or highways shall be prepared and kept on file in the office of the village clerk these plats shall be open to inspection of all persons during the office hours of the clerk  duty of clerk to provide information it shall be the duty of the village clerk to inform any party applying therefor of the numbers belonging to or embraced within the limits of such lot or property as provided in this article  new buildings whenever any house building or structure shall be erected or located in the village after the work of establishing a uniform system of house numbering has been completed it shall be the duty of the owner to procure the correct number from the village clerk as designated for the property and to immediately attach the number so assigned upon the building as provided by this article  responsibility for placing numbers it is hereby made the duty of the owner agent or person in possession of every building in the village to number it in the manner provided in this article  failure to place number if the owner or occupant of any building required to be numbered pursuant to the provisions of this article shall neglect for a period of 60 days to duly attach and maintain the proper number on the subject building the village building and zoning administrator shall serve upon him a notice requiring such owner or occupant to properly number the building and if he neglects to do so for a period of ten days after the service of such notice he shall be deemed to have violated this article in addition to all other remedies any person who violates disobeys omits neglects or refuses to comply with any provision of this section shall be fined as provided in section 115 of this each offense    8222011 defacing or removing numbers in addition to all other remedies any person who shall willfully deface or remove any number placed upon any building in conformity with this article shall be sentenced as provided in section 115 of this ch 106 article i  in general purpose of chapter  statutory authority a this chapter regulating the subdivision of land is hereby made a part of the official plan of the village and contiguous areas the purpose of these regulations is to provide for 1 the harmonious development of the village and its environs 2 the coordination of streets within new subdivisions with other existing or planned streets 3 the dedication and acceptance of land required for schools parks playgrounds and other public uses 4 the preparation of subdivision plans and the procedure for the submittal approval and recording of subdivision plats in and about the village b such regulations shall be provided for in accordance with the authority vested in the village under the provisions of 65 ilcs 5111 et seq as it now exists or is hereafter amended  definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning accepted public street means any street duly accepted by the board of trustees of the village for maintenance by the village alley means a public or private way at the rear or side of property permanently reserved as a means of secondary vehicular access to abutting property frontage on an alley shall not be construed as satisfying the requirements of this chapter related to frontage on a dedicated street approved street means any street whether public or private meeting standards and specifications of the village building line means a line within a lot or other parcel of land so designated on the plat of the proposed subdivision collector street and secondary street mean those existing streets designated as such on the official plan of the village and streets proposed as collector streets in new subdivisions which are designed with a rightofway width of 66 feet to 80 feet for access of traffic from several minor streets to a major street commission means the plan commission of the village condominium means any property submitted to the provisions of the condominium property act 765 ilcs 6051 et seq as it now exists or may from time to time hereafter be amended construction traffic means any vehicle with a gvw gross vehicle weight in excess of 8000 pounds delivering material or equipment to a construction site crosswalkway means a strip of land dedicated to public use which is reserved across a block to provide pedestrian access to adjacent areas culdesac means a street having one open end and being permanently terminated by a vehicle turnaround easement means a grant by a property owner for the use of a strip of land by the village the general public a corporation or a certain person for a specific purpose final plat means the drawings and documents described in article ii division 3 of this chapter frontage means all the property on one side of a street between two intersecting streets crossing or terminating measured along the line of the street or if the street is deadended then all the property abutting on one side between an intersecting street and the deadend street frontage road means a public or private marginal access roadway or paved parking lot containing the necessary driveways or trafficways which are located along the frontage of multiplefamily business or industrial zoning districts with regulations for purposes of establishing minimum distances between points of access to the accepted street and eliminating parking of motor vehicles on the accepted public street half street means any roadway road or street which does not include or is not proposed to include all surface improvements indicated on standard detail 16a 16b 16c or 16d improvement and public improvement mean any facility for which the village or other municipal body may ultimately assume the responsibility for maintenance and operation or which is constructed for general public use or benefit industrial street means any street included in any subdivision or plot of ground to be used for industrial purposes as delineated in the zoning regulations of the village chapter 106 intersection street means the area embraced within the prolongation or connection of the lateral curblines or if none then the lateral boundary lines of the roadways of two highways which join one another at or approximately at right angles or the area within which vehicles traveling upon different highways joining at any other angle may come in conflict where a highway includes two roadways 30 feet or more apart then every crossing of each roadway of such divided highway by an intersecting highway shall be regarded as a separate intersection if such intersecting highway also includes two roadways 30 feet or more apart then every crossing of two roadways of such highways shall be regarded as a separate intersection lot means a parcel of land in a subdivision separated from other parcels or portions by virtue of a plat of subdivision recorded with the appropriate county office and identifiable by reference to such plat of subdivision and not dependent for such identification on metes and bounds major street see primary street  marginal access street means a street which is parallel to and adjacent to primary streets and highways and which provides access to abutting properties and protection to local traffic from fast moving traffic on primary streets minor street means a street intended primarily as access to abutting properties owner means the individuals firms associations syndicates copartnerships corporations trusts or any other legal entities having sufficient proprietary interest of record in the land sought to be subdivided to commence and maintain proceedings to subdivide the land under the statutes of the state or under the ordinances of the village planned development means a tract of land which is developed as a unit under single ownership or control which includes two or more principal buildings and which is at least five acres in area plat means a map drawing or chart either onedimensional or threedimensional on which the subdividers plans of the subdivision are presented and which he submits for approval and intends to record in final form ponding means the creation of pockets or depressions which have no surface drainage provided and which in the event of a failure on the part of inlets or storm sewers will contain standing water that portion of surface waters which are flowing will not be considered as ponding preliminary plat means the drawings and documents described in article ii division 2 of this chapter primary street and major street mean a street of considerable continuity which serves or is intended to serve as a major traffic artery compiled statutes public street means all primary secondary and minor streets which are shown on the subdivision plat and are to be dedicated for public use roadway and road mean the paved area existing on the street rightofway and not the street rightofway width street means the width of the street rightofway or easement whether public or private and shall not be considered as the width of paving or other improvement on the street rightofway subdivider means any individuals firms associations syndicates corporations copartnerships trusts or other legal entities commencing proceedings under this chapter to effect a subdivision of land subdivision 1 subdivision means a planned development or the division of land into two or more parts any of which is less than five acres for the access f the conveyance of land for highway or other public purposes or grants or conveyances relating to the dedication of land for public use or instruments relating to the vacation of land impressed with a public use g conveyances made to correct descriptions in prior conveyances h the sale or exchange of parcels or tracts of land following the division into no more than two parts of a the village or for land within the villages comprehensive plan if outside the corporate limits the developer thereof or his agent shall submit both a preliminary plan and a final subdivision plat if applicable to the village such plans and plats proposed improvements and all procedures relating thereto shall in all respects be in full compliance with the regulations contained in this chapter b village board or by any other governing authority  applicability of chapter  required approvals  interpretation of chapter a no land shall after the effective date of be subdivided or filed for record nor any street laid out nor any improvements made to the land until the plat or plans of the subdivision or street improvements shall have been certified to and approved by the action of the plan commission and the board of trustees of the village this approval must be in writing and placed on the original tracing of the final plats according to the procedures outlined in article ii division 3 of this chapter b no lot tract or parcel of land within any such subdivision shall be offered for sale nor shall any sale contract for sale or option be made or given until such subdivision plans have been properly reviewed by the plan commission and the final plat approved by the board of trustees of the village c no improvements such as sidewalks water supply stormwater drainage sewerage facilities lighting grading paving or surfacing of streets shall hereafter be made within any such subdivision by any owner or his agent until the plats for the subdivision and also the plans for improvements thereto have been formally recommended by the plan commission and the final plat officially approved by the board of trustees d subdivisions of land lying outside of the village and within 112 miles of the village limits shall also be required to conform with the requirements of this chapter e where a tract of land is proposed for subdivision which tract is part of a larger logical subdivision unit in relation to the village as a whole the village board of trustees may cause to be prepared a possible plan of the entire area such plan to be used by the plan commission and the village board as an aid in judging the proposed plat f all interpretations of the rules and regulations in this chapter are reserved to the administrative bodies referred to in this chapter g the plan commission may in accordance with section 787 with village board approval vary and make exceptions as set forth in this chapter in instances where there is sufficient evidence in its opinion of hardship caused by topographic conditions or where any other reasonable deterrents prevail provided the variations or exceptions are in substantial conformance with the standards of design of this chapter h whenever the area is divided into lots containing one to three acres inclusive and there are indications that such lots will eventually be resubdivided into small building lots consideration shall be given to the street and lot arrangement of the original subdivision so that additional minor streets can be opened which will permit a logical arrangement of smaller lots i all planned developments whether residential commercial or otherwise in nature and all other developments whether a subdivision or not under the law and whether located in the incorporated limits of the village or outside the corporate limits but within the villages 112mile planning jurisdiction shall also be required to conform with the requirements of this chapter  prerequisites for issuance of building street lights public sidewalks and the germination of stormwater detention facilities and open space lands to be donated in some cases perimeter sidewalks not directly affecting individual lot village engineer or designee whichever is later c model home building permits 1 a special class of building permits shall be issued entitled model home building permit 2 the model home building permit permit has been issued the model home may not be open for inspection to the public until such time that the village building and zoning administrator issues a certificate for such use the certificate accumulation until such time that the village accepts and maintains the improvements e an active fire hydrant shall be located a maximum of 500 feet from the property 4 the holder of the model home permit may apply for an occupancy permit which will not be issued unless and until the village building and zoning administrator is satisfied that the provisions of the village building code are is in addition to and above all other permit fees and charges 6 at any given time the number of model home building permits shall not exceed the lesser of six permits or ten percent of the number of as such on the preliminary plat for the subdivision 4 no model home parking lot permit shall be issued until the applicant has submitted plans satisfactory to the village planning and development administrator in compliance with the provisions of this section including provisions for adequate drainage of the model home parking lot 5 the model home parking lot shall have a hard surface constructed of asphalt concrete or other similar materials resulting in a dustfree surface all portions of a lot governed by a model home parking lot permit not covered with this hard surface shall be landscaped with grass or other ground cover capable of preventing erosion 6 the model home parking lot shall not encroach into the required setbacks of the underlying zoning district and shall not be located within the public rightofway 7 there shall be no more than one model home parking lot permit in effect per subdivision regardless of the number of phases of the subdivision the model home parking lot shall contain no more than ten parking spaces 8 there shall be a charge of $10000 for the model home parking lot permit in addition the holder of the model home parking lot permit shall deposit with the village a letter of credit in an amount determined by the village necessary to cover the cost of removal of the model home parking lot 9 the model home parking lot permit shall remain in effect until the earlier of a a final occupancy permit for the last model home permit for the subdivision is issued  b building permits have been issued for 90 percent of the lots  or c two years reserved article ii  plats division 1  generally secs 78317850  reserved division 2  preliminary plat filing requirements  form and contents a any person owning land within the limits of the village or within 112 miles of such limits wishing to 1 divide the land into lots for the purpose of sale  2 dedicate a part thereof for streets alleys or other public use  3 redivide land previously subdivided  or 4 change the boundaries of any lot or parcel thereof  shall file 17 copies of his preliminary plat of the proposed subdivision with the village clerk for transmittal to the plan commission and village board of trustees b the preliminary plat shall be drawn to a scale of not less than 100 feet to the inch and contain the following 1 the proposed name of the subdivision 2 its location as forming a part of some larger tract or parcel of land referred to in the indexes of the records of the county clerk 3 sufficient information to accurately locate the plat reference to existing streets plats etc may be used if there are none within a reasonable distance of the proposed subdivision a vicinity plat on a small scale should accompany the preliminary plat 4 the description and location of all survey monuments erected in the subdivision 5 a certificate showing ownership of the property described in the preliminary plat and adjacent property owners and subdivisions 6 the boundary lines of the tract to be subdivided accurate in scale and bearing the total approximate area encompassed thereby 7 the location widths and other dimensions of all existing platted streets and other important features such as railroad lines watercourses existing easements exceptional topography etc contiguous to the tract to be subdivided 8 the location widths and other dimensions of proposed streets alleys easements parks and other open spaces 9 all parcels of land intended to be dedicated for public use or reserved for the use of all property owners with the purpose indicated see section 7872 and article v of this chapter 10 north point scale and date of preparation 11 layout numbers and dimensions of lots 12 building setback lines showing dimensions 13 easements for any and all public utilities where alleys are not provided property continuity for the utilities from block to block shall be maintained c the fee for filing the preliminary plat is $10000 for the first five lots and $500 for each additional lot in the subdivision but in no event less than $10000 d the village clerk shall notify the village board of the filing of each preliminary plat and its transmittal to the plan commission e the plan commission shall require the following when necessary 1 contours at an interval of two feet and highwater levels on all watercourses 2 sketches blueprints and other pertinent data on the type of structures proposed to be constructed 3 location size and approximate grades of proposed sewers 4 cross sections of proposed streets showing width of roadways location of sidewalks proposed street grades and proposed elevations of lot corners 5 proposed location of water gas electric and telephone outlets and sanitary and storm sewers f there shall be submitted on each plat the name of the subdivider the subdivision designer and engineer the owner of the property and where the property is held in a trust the owners of the beneficial interest of the trust and the names of adjoining property owners  procedure for approval a hearing before plan commission the plan commission shall provide for an adequate hearing on the preliminary plat and shall notify the applicant by mail at least five days prior to the hearing b action by plan commission 1 the commission shall determine whether the preliminary plat shall be approved approved with modifications or disapproved and shall give written notice to the subdivider of its determination within 90 days of the initial hearing 2 if approved the commission shall so note on the face of the plat and shall thereupon forward the plat to the village board notifying the subdivider of the action if approved with modifications or if disapproved the commission shall attach to the original plat a statement of the reasons for such action and shall return the original of the plat to the subdivider retaining one copy thereof for its records c effect of approval by plan commission  time limits 1 the approval of a preliminary plat by the plan commission is strictly tentative involving merely the general acceptability of the layout submitted this approval shall be effective for a maximum period of 12 months provided that a the subdivider shall within a sixmonth period of preliminary plat approval present to the village board a written status report of the progress of the proposed subdivision  and b the subdivider shall within 12 months obtain the plan commissions and village boards approval of the final plat on an area comprising at least 20 percent of the gross area encompassed in the preliminary plat 2 if final plat approval is not obtained on at least 20 percent of the gross area within 12 months then the preliminary plat is deemed to have expired in addition the subdivider shall obtain final plat approval on increments of at least 20 percent of the preliminary plat in succeeding 12month periods until the subdivision is completed 3 the village board may upon the application of the subdivider within the time periods specified in this subsection grant such extensions of time as it shall deem proper d action by village board the village board shall upon receipt of the report from the plan commission and four copies of the preliminary plat upon motion and majority vote approve or disapprove the preliminary plat and if approved give permission to prepare detailed plans and specifications of the subdivision and public improvements in accordance with the preliminary plat and within the requirements of this chapter e effect of approval by board the approval of a preliminary plat by the village board is tentative only involving merely the general acceptability of the layout as submitted and must have designated thereon the words this is a preliminary plat of no legal effect and not to be recorded f revisions the plan commission may recommend or the village board may require during consideration of a preliminary plat such changes or revisions as are deemed necessary in the interest and needs of the community g proper drainage required no plat will be approved for the subdivision of land which is subject to periodic flooding or which contains extremely poor drainage facilities and which would make adequate drainage of the streets impossible however if the subdivider agrees to make improvements which will in the opinion of the village engineer make the area completely safe for residential occupancy and provide adequate street drainage the preliminary plat of the subdivision may be approved h distribution of signed copies one print of the approved preliminary plat signed by the president and the village clerk shall be retained in the village clerks office and two copies shall be retained in the office of the village engineer and one copy shall be retained in the files of the plan commission one signed copy is authorization for the subdivider to proceed with the preparation of plans and specifications for the minimum improvements required in these rules and regulations and with the preparation of the final plat  secs 78537870  reserved division 3  final plat contents  supplemental documents  drafting standards  review and approval a contents of plat the final plat shall contain the following 1 name of the subdivision 2 location by township section and range or by other legal description 3 scale of one inch to 100 feet or larger shown graphically 4 date and north point 5 boundary of the plat based on an accurate traverse with angles and linear dimensions 6 exact locations widths and names of all streets within and adjoining the plat and the exact location and widths of all crosswalkways streets that are obviously in alignment with others already existing and named shall bear the names of the existing streets 7 true angles and distances to the nearest established street lines or official monuments not less than three which shall be accurately described in the plat 8 municipal township county or section lines accurately tied to the lines of the subdivision by distances and angles 9 radii internal angles points and curvatures tangent bearings and lengths of all arcs 10 all easements for rightsofway provided for public services and utilities 11 all house numbers lot numbers and lines with accurate dimensions in feet and hundredths a house numbers shall be assigned to each lot per the us postmaster new lenox illinois b foundation elevations shall be depicted on the engineering drawings for each lot as established by a licensed engineer in compliance with this chapter or other applicable village ordinances or state law and approved by the village engineer 12 permanent monuments or benchmarks which shall be placed at all corners and at points of tangency of curve lines along the boundary of the subdivision 13 accurate outlines and legal descriptions of any areas to be dedicated or reserved for public use with the purposes indicated thereon and of any area to be reserved by deed covenant for common use of all property owners 14 building setback lines accurately shown by dimension 15 an endorsement on the final plat by the county clerk that he finds no delinquent general taxes or unpaid current general taxes against the land shown thereon 16 a summary on its face of all restrictions applicable to any part of the subdivision relating to building restrictions use restrictions building lines or otherwise 17 a deed of dedication in the form set out in section 78753 18 a certificate of approval as set out in section 78752 b plat for unit of subdivision such final plat may be for a unit of a proposed subdivision provided that 1 a preliminary plat has previously been approved as to the whole subdivision 2 approval by the village engineer is required as to the feasibility of such unit construction 3 the public improvements as outlined in article iv of this chapter for at least one unit shall be submitted and completed within each calendar year from the date of approval of the final plat for the unit 4 the plat for each unit shall be submitted to the plan commission for its approval 5 failure to comply with the terms of this subsection will require officials concerned with the specifications of utility installations 7 final plans and specifications for the improvements required by sections 78131 inclusive in strict conformity with the subdividers preparations for such improvements previously approved by the president and board of trustees or other appropriate authority and signed by the subdivider and owner 8 an agreement executed for plats and plans 1 the village requires that all construction plans for public improvements and subdivision plats be submitted to the village in hard copy and digital format the digital format shall be the latest version of autocad software approved by the village the digital deliverables shall be on 312inch diskettes 2 this subsection shall serve as the drafting standards for cad submittals the goal of this standard is to produce legible drawing sets for construction and an accurate fullsize computer model of the project being built this fullsize computer model shall be inserted into the villages base map upon village approval of the computer file 3 the model shall be prepared using the villages mapping control for a horizontal and vertical coordinate base the model shall be drafted at full scale in the villages horizontal coordinate system model files shall contain all existing and proposed entities contained in the entire set of construction plans and shall encompass the entire project being designed 4 individual drawing sheet files shall be prepared at the appropriate plot scale and contain references to the model file all text shall be labeled on the drawing files not on the model file 5 all symbols shall be in accordance with standard 16865 of the state department of transportation and any amendments or revisions thereto all layering conventions symbols line types and colors shall be in accordance with the village of new lenox layering standards and any amendments or revisions thereto 6 all consultants preparing plans and plats to be submitted to the village shall be provided with a digital file of the prototype model file the consultants model shall conform to the standards set forth in the prototype 7 all subdivision plats engineering plans and asbuilt plans submitted to the village shall be prepared using the villages horizontal and vertical control network as the basis of survey the horizontal control network consists of the commonly accepted monumentation of the quarter section and section corners in new lenox township the vertical control network consists of approximately 50 benchmarks established throughout the township the horizontal datum is the datum used for the flood mapping of hickory creek which is ngvd 1929 the purpose of this requirement is to set forth standards by which survey and engineering data can be inserted into the villages digital map without modification or translation 8 all survey and engineering data shall be based upon the villages established horizontal and vertical coordinates for their respective control monuments at least one of the villages vertical control monuments shall be used in preparing plats of survey topographic surveys engineering plans and asbuilt plans at least two of the villages horizontal control monuments shall be used in preparing plats of subdivision and plats of dedication horizontal control data sheets benchmark data and existing control mapping shall be provided by the village to be used by those parties preparing subdivision plats and engineering plans within the jurisdictional boundaries of the village surveyors and engineers finding village board except in those specific areas designated by the village for development as playfields or other active areas all trees other plant materials streams and other natural features shall be retained on land to be dedicated for public use unless specifically cited by the village for removal by the developer d shape of site dedicated land sites andor open space contributions shall be shall not be less than 20 feet or more than 40 feet j culsdesac the length of a street terminating in a culdesac shall be measured along the centerline of the road from the center of the circle to the near rightofway of the intersecting street and shall not exceed 500 feet for subdivisions with lots having less than 15000 square feet or 900 feet for subdivisions with lots having at least 15000 square feet and no more than 35000 square feet and in no case shall the length exceed 1200 feet where there is a probability of extending a street beyond the present subdivision a t turnaround should be placed within such tract no strip or area shall be reserved along any portion of a street half street or alley which will prevent adjacent property owners access thereto except by consent of the the plan commission at the approximate centers of the blocks the use of additional crosswalkways in any instance to provide safe and convenient access to schools parks or other similar destinations may be recommended by the plan commission 2 shape no specific rule concerning the shape of blocks is made but blocks must fit easily into the overall plan of the village and their design must evidence consideration of lot planning traffic flow and public areas  residential lots standards for residential lots are as follows 1 all side lot lines shall be at right angles to straight street lines or radial to curved street lines unless a variation to this rule will give a better street and lot plan double frontage shall be avoided all residential lots shall abut on a publicly dedicated street 2 the minimum area of lots resulting from the subdivision of tracts within the village after the effective date of shall be 9375 square feet and lots shall have a minimum of 75 feet frontage at the required building line except as otherwise provided in the zoning provisions of this chapter 106 3 except as provided in section 787 the minimum width of residential lots at the building line shall be as follows provided the original frontage of the land to be subdivided is 150 feet or more a all lots containing an area of 12500 square feet or more but less than 15000 square feet shall have a minimum frontage of 75 feet b all lots containing an area of 15000 square feet or more but less than 20000 square feet shall have a minimum frontage of 90 feet c all lots containing an area of 20000 square feet or more but less than 30000 square feet shall have a minimum frontage of 100 feet d all lots containing an area of 30000 square feet or more but less than one acre shall have a minimum frontage of 125 feet e all lots containing an area of one acre but not more than five acres shall have a minimum frontage of 150 feet or a frontage equal to 40 percent of the lot depth whichever is greater 4 where the lots front upon a culdesac or curved road or street having a radius of 200 feet or less the minimum width of the frontage at the lot may be measured at the building line with the width at the rightofway line to be not less than 54 feet with such width being measured on the arc of the street rightofway line 5 the area of the street rightofway whether dedicated to the public or a private street or easement for street purposes shall not be included in calculating the area of the lot to be in accordance with the minimum lot area requirements of the zoning district in which the lot is located an area larger than the minimum requirements are desirable the lot shall also have a width and a depth entirely adequate to provide the necessary yard requirements of the zoning regulations of this chapter 106 6 where corner lots back upon lots facing the side street the corner lots shall have extra width sufficient to permit the establishment of front building lines on both the front and the side of the lots adjoining the streets extra widths shall be provided on all corner lots irrespective of whether they rear upon lots facing the side streets 7 major highway intersections and at all other acute angle intersections which in the opinion of the plan commission are likely to be dangerous to traffic movement shall have a radius of 25 feet at the street corner on business lots a chord may be substituted with the approval of the commission for the circular arc where grade separation structures are proposed at the intersection of major highways the lots and improvements in the subdivision shall be arranged so as to make adequate provision for such structures 8 a watercourse drainageway channel or stream shall have additional minimum width or depth as whether the subdivision is platted for sale in lots tracts or parcels or is planned to be held in one ownership and leased  building lines a minimum building lines shall be shown on plats of than required by any zoning regulation applying to the property where the subdivided area is not under zoning control the subdivider shall establish building lines in accordance with the needs of each addition but in no case shall such building lines be less than 30 feet from the rightofway of the street or highway upon which the lot fronts except where all frontage on one side of the street subgrade in subdivisions portland cement concrete curb and gutter shall be placed on both sides of the street and shall be placed on a subgrade checked and approved by the village engineer b specifications for concrete all concrete shall meet state department of transportation specifications for class x concrete 3500 psi in 14 days concrete slump shall be from two to four inches all work shall be in accordance with section 616 of the standard specifications unless otherwise noted c contraction joints contraction joints shall be constructed every 25 linear feet and shall be oneeighth inch in thickness and shall penetrate at least two inches below the surface d expansion joints expansion joints shall be threefourthsinchthick preformed expansion joint filler cut to the exact cross section of the curb or gutter expansion joints shall be placed at a minimum of 200 feet and at every radius point e type and design curb and gutter shall be type b612 on primary or major streets and type m612 on minor streets and shall conform to the standard details  sidewalks a required  location  width and thickness in subdivisions portland cement concrete sidewalks shall be constructed on both sides of the street and shall be one foot from the property line of the lots and along such line as extended at intersections and shall be a minimum of four feet from the street curb or roadway when possible sidewalks shall be four feet in width and not less than five inches in thickness b specifications for concrete all concrete shall meet state department of transportation specifications for class x concrete 3500 psi in 14 days concrete slump shall be from two to four inches all work shall be in accordance with section 624 of the standard specifications unless otherwise noted in the specifications c subgrade preparation the subgrade shall be tamped or rolled until thoroughly compacted at locations where a sidewalk is constructed at entrances the sidewalk shall be thickened to the thickness of the adjacent entrance or driveway pavement all subgrade shall be prepared with sufficient granular material to form a level working platform for concrete pavement of three inches minimum depth material shall be approved sand road mix or gravel d expansion joints expansion joints of the thickness specified in this subsection shall consist of preformed joint filler the top of the joint shall be in place onefourth inch below the surface of the sidewalk 1 onehalfinch expansion joints expansion joints onehalf inch thick shall be placed between the sidewalk and all structures such as light standards traffic light standards traffic poles and subway columns which extend sidewalk 2 threefourthsinch expansion joints expansion joints threefourths inch thick shall be placed at intervals of not more than 100 feet in the sidewalk where the sidewalk is constructed adjacent to pavement or a curb having expansion joints the expansion joints in the sidewalk shall be placed opposite the existing expansion joints as nearly as practicable expansion joints shall also be placed where the sidewalk abuts existing sidewalks between driveway pavement and the sidewalk and between the sidewalk and curbs where the sidewalk abuts a curb e commercial locations sidewalks shall be required at all commercial locations within the village upon being granted a building permit to construct the commercial structure or to enlarge alter or restore a commercial building to an amount equal to or in excess of 50 percent of the cost of the entire building or structure the 50 percent determination shall be made by the building and zoning administrator who shall calculate the cost of the current structure and proposed improvement from the boca valuation data report as referenced in exhibit a of  and as adjusted by plus five percent on each subsequent may 1 all sidewalks in commercial locations shall be five feet in width and not less than five inches in thickness shall be located on the public rightofway one foot off the property line or at a location approved by the village engineer and shall conform to all other specifications of this the construction of sidewalks f estate zoning district sidewalks are not required as part of subdivision improvements in the estate zoning district provided that walks are not needed to continue a master or regional sidewalk plan that encompasses the development under consideration  water supply fire hydrants and sanitary sewer system no subdivision shall be approved without water supply and sanitary sewer and sewage treatment facilities in accordance with the following minimum standards or the posting of surety bonds or security approved by the village board guaranteeing such improvements in accordance with this chapter before recommending approval of a subdivision the plan commission will consider the availability of sanitary sewer facilities or the lack thereof to the proposed subdivision the following shall be the minimum requirements 1 where public water supply and sanitary sewers and sewage treatment facilities are available the facilities shall be designed and installed in the street rightofway to connect to the public sewer and water system and with approval by the village engineer in accordance with the following requirements regardless of the size of lots in the subdivision a water supply and fire hydrants water mains fire hydrants and services shall be provided to serve all lots and to provide for reasonable expansion of the system fire hydrants shall be installed at a maximum of 300foot intervals on all water mains water mains shall be designed using the criteria of the state environmental protection agency and in accordance with the requirements of the new lenox fire protection district  provided however the inside diameter in no case shall be less than six inches fire hydrants shall be of meuller or traverse city manufacture or their equivalent with auxiliary valves and boxes vaults excepted fire hydrants shall have a 412inch valve opening and 212inch connections all valves and fire hydrants shall open counterclockwise minimum earth cover for water mains shall be five feet b sewers sanitary sewers and services of approved design and capacity with a minimum earth cover of six feet shall be provided to serve all lots and to provide for reasonable expansions of the system sanitary sewers shall be designed using the criteria of the state environmental protection agency sanitary sewer manholes shall be located at points which will minimize the possibility of submergence in storms manholes frames and grates shall be equivalent to neenah foundry r1015 with selfsealing lids and shall be imprinted sewer manholes shall be located at intervals of 400 feet to facilitate maintenance of the sanitary sewer system 2 all residential lots having an area of less than 20000 square feet and all commercial and industrial subdivisions or developments shall be required to install public water and sanitary sewer facilities in accordance with subsections 1a and b of this section 3 where lots have an area of 20000 square feet and a frontage of 100 feet or more in a location where a public water supply or a central water system is available with a capacity of 20000 gallons per day serving more than ten lots and no public sanitary sewer system is available the developer shall install water mains and hydrants or post surety bonds or security approved by the village board as stipulated in subsection 1a of this section and shall either install or post surety bonds guaranteeing installation of approved individual septic tanks 4 where lots have an area of 20000 square feet and a frontage of 100 feet or more in a location where a public sanitary sewer is available and no public water supply or central water system is available with a capacity of 20000 gallons per day serving more than ten lots the developer shall install sanitary sewers or post surety bonds or security approved by the village board as stipulated in subsection 1b of this section and shall install an individual well and water supply system or post a surety bond guaranteeing such installation 5 where lots have an area of 40000 square feet or more and a minimum frontage of 100 feet and no public sewer or public or central water supply system is available the developer shall install individual wells and water supply and individual septic tanks or mechanical sewage treatment systems or post surety bonds or security approved by the village board guaranteeing such installations the design installation and inspection of such individual systems shall be governed by the county sewage treatment and disposal ordinance in effect at the time of application when conflicts arise between the county sewage treatment ordinance and this this supersede the county ordinance where individual wells and septic tanks are to be used on the same lot the preliminary subdivision plans for the lots shall show in addition to the usual data the following items a the proposed location of the water wells for each lot where there are existing wells or septic tanks on the lot or on adjoining lots they must also be shown b a circular area with a radius of 75 feet around each well to denote clear space in which no sewage system is to be located c the outfall area for soil absorption of the effluent from the septic tank which must be situated beyond the 75foot radius and downgrade from the proposed house location with soil absorption meeting percolation test requirements d swamps rock outcroppings or flood zones when they exist on the property or adjacent property 6 all water supply and sanitary sewer systems which are installed or to be installed in the public ways or in easements serving a central system shall be deemed to be dedicated to the village upon the acceptance of the subdivision in all cases where a central water supply system and sewer facilities are installed pursuant to the provisions of this section the water supply system and sewer facilities shall be deemed dedicated to the village upon approval of the plat of the subdivision  storm sewer system a generally every subdivision shall have storm sewers separate and independent of the sanitary sewer system and with an adequate outlet or connection with the existing storm sewer system the storm sewers shall be provided to accept and convey all stormwaters entering upon the subdivision they shall be designed on the basis of a tenyear storm and shall be sized to adequately carry all tributary areas at such time as they are developed to the density shown on the master plan of the village b inlets and outlets  pipe size rear inlets shall be provided with a catchbasin bottom having a depth of at least two feet and the outlet pipes shall be installed in such a manner as to preclude the entrance of floating matter into the storm sewer rear yard inlets shall have a frame and grate similar to neenah foundry r2579 curb inlet frames and grates shall be similar to neenah foundry r3503 or r32868v manhole covers shall be similar to neenah foundry r2015 and imprinted storm sewer storm sewers shall have a catchbasin type inlet and pipes sized to flow full with a minimum velocity of two feet per second c use of open channels open channels of trapezoidal design may be provided on an optional basis in lieu of enclosed storm sewer pipe where the following acreages and conditions are met 1 if the channel will serve as the outlet for the enclosed storm sewers from a drainage area of 80 acres or more the trapezoidal channel shall have a flat base of eight feet or more in width a side slope of  and an easement of 15 feet or more in width with sodding on the full width 2 if the channel will serve as the outlet for a drainage area of 160 acres or more the trapezoidal channel shall have a flat base of ten feet or more a side slope of  and an easement 20 feet or more in width with sodding on the full width 3 if the channel will serve as the outlet for a drainage area of 240 acres or more the trapezoidal channel shall have a base of 15 feet or more a side slope of 11 and an easement of 30 feet or more with a sixfoot chainlink fence topped with three strands of barbed wire on arms pointing out 4 open channels serving a drainage area of more than 360 acres shall be subject to design and easement requirements to be stipulated by the village engineer at the time the subdividers preliminary plat and preliminary improvement design are submitted 5 no open channels shall be permitted within 500 feet of any property used for school church or park purposes d discharge of subsurface seepage water effective on the date of approval of the ordinance from which this subsection is derived all new subdivisions shall install as part of their public improvements individual stormwater services for the discharge of subsurface seepage water per the following criteria 1 trunk lines shall be constructed of minimum sixinch sdr 35 type rubber gasketed pvc sewer pipe to be located in the road rightofway six feet from the front property lines or adjusted as necessary to avoid conflict with public walks lines shall have a tracer wire installed immediately above them terminating at the cleanouts stubs and catchbasin the wire shall be strapped to stubs and cleanouts with nylon cable ties 2 trunk lines shall be installed a minimum of 30 inches below the top of the curb and shall follow the vertical curb alignment 3 trunk lines shall originate at the nearest curb inlet or storm sewer manhole 4 sixinch stubs shall be provided at every other property line to service two adjoining lots stubs shall have a sixinch wye attached to the end to allow connection of two adjacent lots and be a minimum of six feet in length stubs shall be left in a vertical position to permit easier location until connection by the individual builder at that time which must be prior to installation of the public walk the builder shall trench across the sixfoot area between the trunk line and the property line and lower the stub to an acceptable level maintaining positive grade and backfill with suitable granular fill to prevent settling of the public walk 5 trunk lines shall terminate at the nearest property line of the last lot to be serviced with a surface cleanout at the proposed sidewalk grade upon installation the sidewalk shall be stamped clean out at the appropriate locations 6 trunk lines shall be sixinch for up to four homes and eightinch for five to ten homes in no event shall more than ten homes be connected to any one continuous trunk line 7 all bends will be constructed with sanitary tees and cleanouts 8 from the subsurface seepage water trunk line stub at the property line to a point directly below the sump pump discharge the builder will install 4 sdr 35 type rubber gasketed pvc sewer pipes bedded with c7 stone at sufficient slope to maintain flow and an adequate depth to prevent freezing at time of connection to the wye fitting at the front property line the builder shall cap any open remaining parts to prevent soil intrusion prior to the adjacent builders connection to the system this line shall not be directly connected to the sump pump discharge an air gap must be maintained for the unlikely event of trunk line surcharge a tracer wire shall be installed immediately above this line connection the main line tracer and strapped to the exposed end of the line with a nylon cable tie    9192001 feet of street length culdesac lots shall have at least one tree provided all location requirements of section 781452 are met 2 location trees shall be planted halfway between the curb and sidewalk no less than 30 feet apart at least ten feet from all driveways manholes and fire hydrants and at least 30 feet from all streetlights no tree shall be planted closer than 40 feet from an intersection as six inches above grade 4 species all trees planted in parkways shall be chosen from the following list a autumn blaze b state street maple c marmo maple d red maple e hackberry f thornless honey parkway tree plan  financial security a parkway tree plan a parkway tree plan indicating the location of the improvements required by section 781451 shall be submitted as accompanying documents to a final plat in accordance with the provisions of sections 78717 b financial security a letter of credit or security approved by the village board in an amount as determined as follows 1 construction costs  approved engineers estimate of public improvements 2 warranty contingency equals ten percent of 1 3 inflationary contingency equals 15 percent of 1 4 surety amount equals 1 + 2 + 3 shall be provided to the village prior to the village executing the final plat 6 specifications a general all trees shall conform to the american standard for nursery stock as approved by the american standards institute incorporated and issued as ansi z6011996 or as amended b shape size and propagation procedures all trees shall be propagated by commonly accepted methods fruit and seed germination budded cuttings grafted etc for the given tree species and cultivar all trees shall be straight healthy uniformly shaped typical representatives of their normal species or varieties each tree shall have a recognizable and definable central leader throughout the entire head of the tree and shall have typical branch growth in all quadrants of the crown which shall not be a result of severe pruning all terminal buds shall be in place at the time of planting all trees shall be freshly dug free of insect pests plant diseases sun scald frost crack fresh abrasions and other injuries and with healthy welldeveloped root systems c digging of plant materials and ball characteristics all plants shall be balled and burlapped the rootflare of the tree shall be at the top of the ball and if necessary surface soil shall be removed to obtain such conditions before digging begins the balls shall be prepared in a workmanlike manner and firmly bound ball diameter shall conform to the ansi z6011996 standards d planting holes all planting holes shall be at least 20 inches larger in diameter than the tree ball to a depth such that the tree when planted will be situated with the root collar at grade the sides of the hole shall slope inward towards the bottom of the root ball planting holes shall be dug no more than 24 hours before planting e tree basins water retention saucers tree basins shall be formed around each tree planted f mulch all trees shall be mulched with a fourinch depth of wood chips or other approved mulch the mulched surface area shall extend from the base of the tree to a point beyond the circumference of the disturbed area mulch shall not be placed against the trunk of the tree g removal of materials all excess excavated materials from the planting holes shall be removed and disposed of by the developer 7 installation of trees guarantee a installation of trees on an annual or semiannual basis developer shall contract for the installation of parkway trees for all lots requiring parkway trees and that have received certificates of occupancy during that year planting will be done in the spring andor fall of each year notwithstanding anything to the contrary at such time as 90 percent of the lots in a given subdivision or unit of a subdivision have received certificates of occupancy all parkway trees shall be installed in accordance with the parkway tree master plan required in 5a b guarantee developer shall guarantee all parkway trees for a period of one year after installation if during that time village in its sole discretion determines that a tree is in need of replacement due to infestation mortality or growth not in accordance with the standards of section 781456b developer shall replace such tree during the next scheduled planting but in no case later than six months after written notice by village that the tree is in need of replacement 8 prior ordinances the provisions of ordinance no 1114 shall continue to be in full force and effect satisfactory to the village    12112017 criteria for dedication of land a determination of required land area the ultimate number of students to be generated by a subdivision or planned unit development shall bear directly upon the land area required to be dedicated for school sites the land dedication requirement shall be determined by obtaining the ratio of 1 the estimated number of children to be served in each such school classification to 2 the maximum recommended number of students to be served in each such school classification as stated in this article and then applying such ratio to the minimum recommended number of acres for a school site of each such school classification as stated in this article the product thereof shall be the acres of land deemed needed to have sufficient land for school sites to serve the estimated increased children in each such school classification _____ b school classifications and minimum size of sites school classifications and the size of school sites within the village shall be determined in accordance with the following criteria school classification by grades maximum number of students for each such school classification minimum number of acres of land for each school site of such classification elementary schools grades kindergarten students 11 acres junior high schools grades 6 students 19 acres high schools grades 9  students 50 acres c location of sites the comprehensive school plan andor the standards adopted by the affected school district shall to the extent practicable be used as a guideline in locating school sites    12112017 criteria for cash contribution in lieu of dedication a authority to require cash contribution in lieu of dedication  use of funds where the development is small and the resulting school site is too small to be practical or when the available land is inappropriate for a school site the village shall require the builder to pay a cash contribution in lieu of the land dedication required the cash contributions in lieu of school sites shall at the time of issuance of building permits be paid to the appropriate school districts for use in the acquisition of land for a school site to serve the immediate or future needs of children from that subdivision or development or for the improvement of any existing school site which already serves or will serve such needs or for the construction of any school buildings or additions thereto or for the retirement of any bonds issued for school construction or improvements b amount of contribution 1 fair market value the amount of cash contributions in lieu of land shall be based on the improved fair market value of land in the proposed subdivision or planned unit development the cash contributions in lieu of land shall be based on the fair market value set forth in section 7872a7c supra that otherwise would have been dedicated unless the subdivider or developer files a written objection thereto in the event of any such objection the subdivider or developer shall submit an appraisal showing the fair market value of such improved land in the area of the subdivision or planned unit development or other evidence thereof and final determination of the fair market value per acre of such improved land shall be made by the village board c criteria for requiring both dedication and cash contribution situations may arise where a combination of land dedication and a cash contribution in lieu of land are both necessary and appropriate these occasions generally arise when 1 portion of land only a portion of the land proposed as the location for a school site lies within the subdivision or planned unit development in such a situation the subdivider or developer shall dedicate such portion of the land within the subdivision or planned unit development that falls within the proposed school site location as provided in this section and then make a cash contribution in lieu of further dedication in an amount equal to the difference between the required land area dedication pursuant to this section and the land area actually dedicated 2 majority of land a major part of the school site has already been acquired and only a small portion of land is needed from the development to complete the site in such a situation the subdivider or developer shall dedicate only the remaining portions of land required for the school site and then make a cash contribution in lieu of further dedication such contribution in lieu of dedication shall be in an amount equal to the difference between the required land area dedication pursuant to this section and the land area actually dedicated    4231997  1173a 4141998   12112017 _____ determination of population density a table of approved by the village board according to its environmental quality as well as its suitability for school facilities the land is to be dry and usable at all times and not subject to flooding or used as detention b should a land dedication include a detentionretention area over and above the required minimum acres required under this article said land may be accepted no bogs or swamps shall be acceptable as required land dedications lakes and native prairie wetlands shall not normally be acceptable but may be approved where the area offers an exceptional amenity or the chance to protect a significant natural resource sites that have been part of an unlicensed landfill or a toxic waste dump shall not be acceptable as required land dedications c every effort shall be made to conserve for public use and enjoyment those areas of significant natural and environmental value the slope topography and geology of the dedicated site as well as its surroundings must be suitable for its intended purpose and approved prior to approval of the final plat grading on sites dedicated for public use shall not greatly differ from the surrounding land and shall be provided with erosion control devices as required by state or village regulations prior to acceptance by the village board d dedicated land sites shall be regularly configured to permit efficient programming security and maintenance sites shall be rectangular or nearly rectangular in shape with no interior angle of the boundary line less than 60 degrees unless specifically approved by the village narrow strips of land small parcels that intrude into adjacent orderly development and leftover parcels that are oddly shaped or located shall not be accepted as part of the required land dedication    12112017 improvements a prior to operator any individual firm company corporation or association that owns or operates an establishment where tattooing or body piercing is performed and any individual who performs or practices the with or without body piercing or a body piercing establishment without first having obtained a license as hereinafter provided  4271999 application fee every applicant for a license to maintain shall within 45 days inspect the premises proposed to be operated as a tattoo or body piercing establishment and make recommendations to the clerk concerning the compliance with the codes of the village upon receipt of the recommendations of the respective village departments the clerk shall notify the applicant as to whether his application has been granted denied or held for further premises no tattoo or body piercing establishment shall receive a license or be operated established or maintained unless the establishment shall comply with each of the following minimum regulations 1 the establishment shall have a certificate of compliance or inspection by the will county health department if available 2 the enclosed area of not less than 500 square feet the walls floors and ceiling shall have an impervious smooth and washable surface 3 toilet facilities shall be provided within the establishment when five or more employees or patrons of different sexes are on the premises at the same time separate toilet facilities shall be provided lavatories shall be provided with both hot and cold running water and shall be installed in the toilet room lavatories shall be provided with soap and a dispenser with sanitary towels 4 all tables and other equipment shall be constructed of easily cleanable material shall be painted or finished in a light color with a smooth washable finish and shall be separated from waiting customers or observers by a solid wall or door totally eliminating any view into the tattooing or body piercing room 5 closed cabinets shall be provided for use in the storage of clean linens towels needles and other materials and instruments used in tattooing or body piercing all used linens towels equipment instruments and other materials shall be kept in properly covered containers or cabinets which shall be kept separate from the clean storage areas 6 the entire premises and equipment shall be maintained in a clean sanitary condition and in good repair 7 no tattoo or body piercing establishment shall be open to the public for business between the hours of  pm and  am 8 the main entrance door of any tattoo or body piercing establishment shall be visible from a public street and shall remain unlocked during business hours 9 the business shall also comply with all of the terms and conditions set forth within of the municipal respect to business licenses  4271999 operating requirements a the operator shall wash his hands thoroughly with antiseptic soap and water before starting any tattoo or body piercing  the hands shall be dried with individual single use towels b the area on the patron to be tattooed or pierced shall first be thoroughly washed with a sterile single use sponge with warm water containing an antiseptic liquid soap for a tattoo the area should be shaved with a safety razor using single service blades for each customer or patron followed by a solution of 70 percent alcohol to be applied to the area before tattooing is begun c only petroleum jelly in collapsible metal or plastic tubes shall be used on the area to be tattooed and it shall be applied with sterile gauze d single service or individual containers of dye or ink shall be used for each tattoo patron and the container therefor shall be discarded immediately after completing work on each patron any dye in which the needles are dipped shall not be used on another person all needles pigments dyes colors and any other material used in tattooing or body piercing and all bandages and surgical dressings used in connection with tattooing or body piercing shall be sterile and free from bacteria virus particles and noxious agents and substances after completing work on any person the tattooed or pierced area shall be washed with sterile gauze and 70 percent alcohol solution and allowed to dry a sterile gauze dressing shall be fastened to the tattooed area e no tattooing or body piercing shall be done on any skin surface that has rash pimples boils infections or manifests any evidence of unhealthy conditions no person customer or patron having any communicable disease shall be tattooed or pierced all infections resulting from the practice of tattooing or body piercing which become known to the operator shall be promptly reported to the village by the person owning or operating the tattooing or body piercing establishment and the infected client shall be referred to a physician f no skin area shall be penetrated abraded or treated with chemicals for the purpose of removing camouflaging or altering any blemish birthmark scar or tattoo g operators shall at all times while in the performance of their services wear uniforms or garments which cover the torso and said garments shall be kept clean and in a sanitary condition h no person while on the premises of any tattoo or body piercing establishment shall possess sell dispense provide give keep or maintain any alcoholic beverage i no intoxicated person shall be tattooed or pierced by an operator on the licensed premises j operators shall at all times comply with the regulations of the department of labors occupational safety and health administration as presently existing or hereafter amended with respect to occupational exposure to blood bloodborne pathogens or other potentially infectious materials which regulations are incorporated by reference herein  4271999 care and storing of instruments a storing of instruments all clean and ready to use instruments and single service needles shall be kept in a closed glass or metal case or storage compartment while not in use the cabinet shall be maintained in a sanitary manner at all times b sterilizing of instruments a steam sterilizer autoclave shall be provided for sterilizing all instruments before use on any customer person or patron sterilization of equipment will be accomplished by exposure to live steam for at least 30 minutes at a minimum pressure of 15 pounds per square inch temperature of 240 f or 116 c c use of instruments the needles and instruments required to be sterile shall be so used handled and temporarily placed during tattooing or piercing so that they will not be contaminated  4271999 records permanent records for each patron or customer shall be maintained by the licensee or operator of the establishment before the tattooing or body piercing operation begins the patron or customer shall be required personally to enter on a record form provided for such establishments the date his name address age and his signature the records shall be maintained in the tattoo or body piercing establishment and shall be available for examination by the village records shall be retained by the operator or licensee for a period of not less than two years in the event of a change of ownership or closing of the business all such records shall be made available to the village  4271999 inspections any village department or agency may the business or use of the premises has made a false statement on any application for license under this chapter or in the event that the licensee shall refuse to permit any authorized police officer or authorized member of the police department or building department of the village to inspect the premises or the operations thereof at reasonable times  4271999 transfer of license prohibited no place within the licensed establishment so that the same may be readily seen by persons entering the establishment  4271999 exemptions the provisions of this chapter shall not apply to licensed medical doctors or doctors of osteopathic medicine who perform body piercing or tattoo individuals while in the course of their medical practice  4271999 requirement for body piercing body piercing state or county requirements the state or county requirements shall control  4271999 malpractice insurance the operator shall keep and maintain malpractice insurance in an amount of at least $10000000 delivers the electricity to the purchaser and if unpaid is recoverable in the same manner as the original charge for delivering the electricity any tax required to be collected by this chapter and any tax in fact collected shall constitute a debt owed to the village by the person delivering the electricity provided that the person delivering electricity shall be allowed credit for such tax related to deliveries of electricity the charges for which are written off as uncollectible and provided further that if such charges are thereafter collected the delivering supplier shall be obligated to remit such tax any partial payment not specifically identified by the purchaser shall be deemed to be for the delivery of electricity persons delivering electricity shall collect the tax from the purchaser by adding such tax to the gross charge for delivering the electricity in the manner prescribed by the village persons delivering electricity shall also be authorized to add to such gross charge an amount equal to three percent of the tax to reimburse the person delivering electricity for the expense incurred in keeping records billing customers preparing and filing returns remitting the tax and supplying data to the village upon request if the person delivering electricity fails to collect the tax from the purchaser then the purchaser shall be required to pay the tax directly to when approaching and crossing an intersection when approaching and going around a curve when approaching a hill crest when traveling upon any narrow or winding roadway or when special hazards exist with respect to pedestrians or other traffic or by reason of weather or highway conditions  and speed shall be decreased as may be necessary to avoid colliding with any person or vehicle on or village at a speed which is greater than is reasonable and proper with regard to the traffic conditions and the use of the highway or which endangers the safety of any person or property d restriction implement of husbandry or road tractor is operated on a highway within the village at a speed of less than 20 miles per hour there shall be displayed at all times during such operation a red flag at least 12 inches square carried on such vehicle at a height not less than ten feet and not more than 12 feet above the ground or at least one flashing amber signal lamp mounted as high as practicable between sunrise and sunset such vehicle shall at all times display at least one flashing amber signal lamp mounted as high as practicable and of sufficient intensity to be visible to the rear a distance of at least 500 feet if used in normal sunlight  provided however that only the rear vehicle of a combination of vehicles coupled together need display such a flag or lamp g ambulances the speed limits established by this division do not apply to ambulances in motion which includes any motor vehicle primarily designed and used for conveyance of sick or injured persons provided 1 the person operating the ambulance reasonably believes that he is responding to a bona fide emergency call or is specifically directed by a licensed physician to disregard speed limit laws in operating the ambulance during and for the purpose of the specific trip or journey involved 2 the ambulance shall be equipped with a siren producing an audible signal of an intensity of 100 decibels at a distance of 50 feet from the siren and with a lamp emitting an oscillating rotating or flashing red beam directed in part toward the front of the vehicle and visible under normal atmospheric conditions from a distance of 500 feet to the front of such vehicle the siren and lamp shall be in full operation at all times during such journey 3 the provisions of this section do not relieve the driver of an ambulance from the duty to drive with due regard for the safety of all persons using the street nor do these provisions protect the driver of any such vehicle from the consequences of a reckless disregard of the safety of others h information to be stated on citations in every charge of violation of a provision of this division by failure to observe an applicable speed limit the
